title: Prohibits ex parte communications with the public service commission by parties to pending adjudicatory proceedings
summary: Prohibits ex parte communications with the public service commission by parties to pending adjudicatory proceedings.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1598

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. KELLNER -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BENE-
         DETTO, BRENNAN, CLARK, MILLMAN,  PAULIN,  SWEENEY  --  read  once  and
         referred to the Committee on Corporations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  public service law and the state administrative
         procedure act, in relation  to  ex  parte  communications  before  the
         public service commission

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The public service law is amended by adding a  new  section
    2  20-a to read as follows:
    3    S  20-A.  EX PARTE COMMUNICATIONS. 1. UNLESS REQUIRED FOR THE DISPOSI-
    4  TION OF EX PARTE MATTERS  AUTHORIZED  BY  LAW,  A  COMMISSIONER  OR  ANY
    5  EMPLOYEE  OF  THE  DEPARTMENT WHO IS ASSIGNED TO RENDER A DECISION OR TO
    6  MAKE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW IN AN ADJUDICATORY PROCEED-
    7  ING BEFORE THE COMMISSION SHALL NOT COMMUNICATE, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY,
    8  IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ISSUE OF FACT OR OF LAW, WITH ANY PARTY,  OR  THE
    9  REPRESENTATIVE  OF ANY PARTY, EXCEPT UPON NOTICE AND OPPORTUNITY FOR ALL
   10  PARTIES TO PARTICIPATE. PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT ANY SUCH COMMISSIONER OR
   11  EMPLOYEE (A) MAY COMMUNICATE WITH OTHER COMMISSIONERS, AND (B) MAY  HAVE
   12  THE AID AND ADVICE OF AGENCY STAFF OTHER THAN STAFF WHICH HAS BEEN OR IS
   13  ENGAGED IN THE INVESTIGATIVE OR PROSECUTING FUNCTIONS IN CONNECTION WITH
   14  THE CASE UNDER CONSIDERATION OR A FACTUALLY RELATED CASE.
   15    2.  A PARTY IN AN ADJUDICATORY PROCEEDING BEFORE THE COMMISSION OR THE
   16  REPRESENTATIVE OF ANY SUCH PARTY  SHALL  NOT  COMMUNICATE,  DIRECTLY  OR
   17  INDIRECTLY,  IN  CONNECTION  WITH  ANY  ISSUE  OF  FACT OR OF LAW WITH A
   18  COMMISSIONER OR ANY EMPLOYEE OF THE DEPARTMENT WHO IS ASSIGNED TO RENDER
   19  A DECISION OR TO MAKE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF  LAW  IN  SUCH
   20  ADJUDICATORY  PROCEEDING  EXCEPT  UPON  NOTICE  AND  OPPORTUNITY FOR ALL
   21  PARTIES TO PARTICIPATE.
   22    3. IF THE COMMISSIONER OR ANY EMPLOYEE OF THE DEPARTMENT SHALL RECEIVE
   23  ANY COMMUNICATION, ORAL OR WRITTEN,  CONTRARY  TO  THE  PROHIBITIONS  IN

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03913-01-1

       A. 1598                             2

    1  SUBDIVISIONS  ONE AND TWO OF THIS SECTION, HE OR SHE SHALL MAKE A RECORD
    2  OF SUCH COMMUNICATION AND FILE SUCH RECORD PROMPTLY WITH  THE  SECRETARY
    3  OF THE COMMISSION. THE SECRETARY OF THE COMMISSION SHALL SERVE COPIES OF
    4  SUCH  RECORD ON EACH PARTY TO THE ADJUDICATORY PROCEEDING. ANY PARTY MAY
    5  PETITION THE COMMISSION FOR SUCH SANCTIONS AGAINST A PARTY THAT HAS MADE
    6  SUCH COMMUNICATION CONTRARY TO THE PROHIBITION  IN  SUBDIVISION  TWO  OF
    7  THIS SECTION AS MAY BE JUST IN THE CIRCUMSTANCES.
    8    4. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION THE TERM "ADJUDICATORY PROCEEDING"
    9  SHALL  BE  DEFINED AS IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION ONE HUNDRED TWO OF
   10  THE STATE ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURE ACT, EXCEPT THAT THIS  SECTION  SHALL
   11  NOT APPLY TO PROCEEDINGS TO DETERMINE APPLICATIONS FOR INITIAL LICENSES;
   12  PROVIDED  THAT THIS SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY TO PROCEEDINGS INVOLVING THE
   13  VALIDITY OR APPLICATION OF RATES, FACILITIES,  OR  PRACTICES  OF  PUBLIC
   14  UTILITY COMPANIES.
   15    S  2.  Subdivision 2 of section 307 of the state administrative proce-
   16  dure act is amended to read as follows:
   17    2. Unless required for the disposition of ex parte matters  authorized
   18  by  law, members or employees of an agency assigned to render a decision
   19  or to make findings of fact and conclusions of law  in  an  adjudicatory
   20  proceeding  shall not communicate, directly or indirectly, in connection
   21  with any issue of fact, with any person or  party,  nor,  in  connection
   22  with any issue of law, with any party or his representative, except upon
   23  notice  and opportunity for all parties to participate.  Any such agency
   24  member (a) may communicate with other members of the agency, and (b) may
   25  have the aid and advice of agency staff other than staff which has  been
   26  or   is  engaged  in  the  investigative  or  prosecuting  functions  in
   27  connection with the case under consideration or factually related case.
   28    This subdivision does not apply [(a) in determining  applications  for
   29  initial   licenses   for  public  utilities  or  carriers;  or  (b)]  to
   30  proceedings [involving the validity or application of rates, facilities,
   31  or practices of public utilities or carriers] BEFORE THE PUBLIC  SERVICE
   32  COMMISSION.
   33    S  3.    This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to all
   34  proceedings instituted after such  effective  date;  provided,  however,
   35  that  with  respect  to  proceedings  in process prior to such effective
   36  date, this act shall apply as of the date specified in an order  of  the
   37  public  service  commission  in  response to the motion of any party, or
   38  ninety days after such effective date, whichever is earlier.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law and the state administrative procedure act, in relation to ex parte communications before the public service commission
